intro: Chaptalia leiocarpa, commonly known as the white-flowered chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and often used in traditional herbal medicine. Chaptalia leiocarpa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
